greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..n-k} binomial(n,2j)*binomial(n-2j,k).
comment: Product of Pascal's triangle A007318 and A119467. Row sums are A007051. Diagonal sums are A113225.
Variant of A080928, A115068 and A082137. - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 09 2010
Matrix inverse of the Euler tangent triangle A081733. - _Peter Luschny_, Jul 18 2012
Central column: T(2*n,n) = A069723(n). - _Peter Luschny_, Jul 22 2012
Subtriangle of the triangle in A198792. - _Philippe Deléham_, Nov 10 2013
formula: p(x,k) = CharacteristicPolynomial[A[n,m,k],x]; then t(n,m) = coefficients(p(x,n)). - _Roger L. Bagula_ and _Gary W. Adamson_, Jan 25 2009

E.g.f.: [(e^(2t)+1)/2] e^(tx) = e^(P.(x)t), so this is an Appell sequence with lowering operator D = d/dx and raising operator R = x + 2/(e^(-2D)+1), i.e., D P_n(x) = n P_{n-1}(x) and R p_n(x) = P_{n+1}(x) where P_n(x) = [(x+2)^n + x^n]/2. Also, (P.(x)+y)^n = P_n(x+y), umbrally. R = x + 1 + D - 2 D^3/3! + ... contains the e.g.f.(D) mod signs of A009006 and A155585 and signed, aerated A000182, the zag numbers, so the unsigned differential component 2/[e^(2D)+1] = 2 Sum_{n >= 0} Eta(-n) (-2D)^n/n!, where Eta(s) is the Dirichlet eta function, and 2 *(-2)^n Eta(-n) = (-1)^n (2^(n+1)-4^(n+1)) Zeta(-n) = (2^(n+1)-4^(n+1)) B(n+1)/(n+1) with Zeta(s), the Riemann zeta function, and B(n), the Bernoulli numbers. The polynomials PI_n(x) of A081733 are the umbral compositional inverses of this sequence, i.e., P_n(PI.(x)) = x^n = PI_n(P.(x)) under umbral composition. Aside from the signs and the main diagonals, multiplying this triangle by 2 gives the face-vectors of the hypercubes A038207. - _Tom Copeland_, Sep 27 2015
maple: for n from 0 to 7 do A119468_row(n) od; # _Peter Luschny_, Aug 01 2012
for n from 0 to 9 do seq(T(n,k), k=0..n) od; # _Peter Luschny_, Nov 10 2017
mathematica: A[k_] := Table[If[m < n, 1, -1], {m, k}, {n, k}]; a = Join[{{1}}, Table[(-1)^n*CoefficientList[CharacteristicPolynomial[A[n], x], x], {n, 1, 10}]]; Flatten[a] (* _Roger L. Bagula_ and _Gary W. Adamson_, Jan 25 2009 *)
program: return 1 if n==0 else add((-1)^n*binomial(n,k)*(x^(n-k)-1) for k in range(n))
for n in (0..8) : print(A119468_row(n)) # _Peter Luschny_, Jul 22 2012
xref: A082137 read as triangle with rows reversed.
results.author: _Paul Barry_, May 21 2006
